reporting-org.narrative: Ministry for Foreign Affairs of Finland

title.narrative: Accredited business partner for service business in Mozambique

description.narrative: The aim of the project is to find local partners companies a university or a foundation with which Soprano can implement its business strategy. A part of the strategy is to find local partners that can be accreditated. Accreditation means that the partners are trained to market and sell the joint offer of Soprano and its partners to produce locally educational content (including digital content for the Soprano?s learning environment) and to identify and provide local experts that can be used in projects and as training providers.Soprano aims to build 2-3 partnerships that will enable it to participate in international donor projects and provide trainings and other expert services to international companies and administrations in the country. From Soprano's p oint of view these are the most attractive customer segments in Mozambique.A concrete example of an interesting project is the World Bank's Higher Education II project which is expected to start in June 2019 with an initial budget of 80 MUSD. It includes a number of teacher education programs and the development of vocational education and training systems.Based on our current market understanding developing the education and health sector as well as providing services to these sectors are the most promisin g business areas for us in Mozambique in the next 5-10 years.
